title: Strictly Halloween songs revealed as Michelle Visage performs an Addams Family foxtrot
text:
It's one of the highlights of the Strictly Come Dancing calendar, and this year's Halloween special is set to deliver some spectacularly spooky routines.

The song choices and dances for the celebs and their pro partners have been revealed by the BBC ahead of this Saturday's live show.

Halloween classics like the Addams Family theme are mixed in with more modern offerings from the likes of Billie Eilish, while Backstreet Boys' spooky classic Everybody will be danced to for the first time ever on the show.

Spooky: The dances and song choices for the Halloween special have been revealed ahead of Saturday's live show, with Michelle Visage dancing to the Addams Family theme

Comedian Chris Ramsey and his partner Karen Hauer will perform a Samba to the pop hit, which was previously played by the show's band during last year's Halloween show but has never been used for a celeb routine.

Michelle Visage takes on another iconic Halloween track, dancing a Foxtrot with her partner Giovanni to the Addams Family theme.

Ghostbusters by Ray Parker Jr is the song of choice for footballer Alex Scott and her partner Neil Jones, who are taking on this week's Couples' Choice routine, showcasing their street/commercial moves.

Classic: Chris Ramsey and Karen Hauer will dance to Halloween mega hit Everybody by Backstreet Boys, marking the first time ever the song has been danced to on Strictly

Moves: Ghostbusters by Ray Parker Jr is the song of choice for footballer Alex Scott and her partner Neil Jones, who are taking on this week's Couples' Choice routine

Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe are practicing their Cha Cha routine to Steps hit Scared of the Dark while Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse have chosen a more modern chart hit in the form of Billie Eilish's Bad Guy.

EastEnders' Emma Barton and Anton Du Beke are going down a classical route with their tango to Toccata and Fugue in D Minor by Bach.

There are some less spooky song choices with Mike Bushell dancing a Tango to Gwen Stefani's What You Waiting For.

Pop hit: Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe are practicing their Cha Cha routine to Steps hit Scared of the Dark

David James and his professional partner Nadiya Bychkova were the fourth couple to be voted off Strictly on Sunday.

The former goalkeeper and Nadiya faced off against Mike Bushell and Katya Jones in the dance off after receiving the lowest number of votes from the public.

Both couples vied to impress the judges by performing their routines again, but David and Nadiya's Jive to Such a Night by Michael Bublé failed to make a lasting impression.
